author: J. Behme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019
review_content: June's Journey is sooo much fun! The stories of her journeys are intriguing and mysterious but never confusing.  The hidden objects scenes are not too difficult and they don't raise your frustration (and your blood pressure 😉) to the point you just want to delete the game. Plus there is a free lightbulb that will help you find the very well-hidden objects that you can use as many times as you need to.Decorating Orchid Island and renovating its landmarks, such as the lighthouse and the wedding chapel, brings out your creativity. There are also challenging detective tasks to do that will give you extra energy bolts, coins, and the compasses that you need to clear out the other areas of the island.What I really like are the picture puzzles that give you background information or explanations about the characters you are gradually introduced to who are important to June throughout her journeys.One downside is that you do have to watch a lot of ads but I'd rather do that than spend money I really don't have to make progress in this game. However I have tried other Hidden Objects games that were so confusing or required your money all of the time or were just plain boring or stupid but June's Journey is by far the greatest of them all! You won't be disappointed when you play this game 😀
